definitions.definition: To connect an object, especially a ship or a boat, to a fixed point.
To cast anchor ; to come to anchor.
examples: Our ship (or the captain) anchored in the stream.

definitions.definition: To stop ; to fix or rest .
To provide emotional stability for a person in distress .
To perform as an anchorman or anchorwoman .
To be stuck ; to be unable to move away from a position.

main_definition: To connect an object, especially a ship or a boat, to a fixed point.

To provide emotional stability for a person in distress .
To perform as an anchorman or anchorwoman .
To be stuck ; to be unable to move away from a position.
